alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:43PM CDT until May 09 at 1:55AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins, agricultural lands along the river begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 20.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday evening and continue falling to 13.7 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 1 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 20.9 Sat 1 PM 16.9 16.4 15.7 Falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
